Instrument.name: The Johnstone Plasma Analyzer (JPA) for Giotto
Instrument.description: The Johnstone Plasma Analyzer (JPA) on the Giotto spacecraft was designed to measure the three-dimensional energy distribution of positive ions in order to study the interaction between the solar wind and ionised cometary particles. The two sensors measure the distribution from 10 eV to 20 eV once per spacecraft spin, and the distribution from 90 eV to 90 keV, with coarse mass discriminations, once every 32 spins.
